intro: Rhabdocaulon gracile, commonly known as the slender glassworts, is a halophyte species that thrives in saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and filtering water. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or reddish and appear in clusters. Rhabdocaulon gracile is adapted to high salinity and can tolerate periodic flooding, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
